solution_line_template: First, we must convert the driving time of {driving_hours} hours and {driving_minutes_extra} minutes to minutes. Since there are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in an hour, driving takes a total of {driving_hours}*{minutes_per_hour} + {driving_minutes_extra} = <<{driving_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}+{driving_minutes_extra}={total_driving_minutes}>>{total_driving_minutes} minutes.

Next, the woman will be on the airplane for one-third of {total_driving_minutes} minutes, or {total_driving_minutes}/{airplane_fraction_denominator} = <<{total_driving_minutes}/{airplane_fraction_denominator}={airplane_flight_time}>>{airplane_flight_time} minutes.

Therefore, in total, the airplane trip will take the woman {drive_to_airport_time} + {wait_to_board_time} + {airplane_flight_time} + {get_off_plane_time} = <<{drive_to_airport_time}+{wait_to_board_time}+{airplane_flight_time}+{get_off_plane_time}={total_airplane_trip_minutes}>>{total_airplane_trip_minutes} minutes.

Thus, the airplane trip is {total_driving_minutes} - {total_airplane_trip_minutes} = <<{total_driving_minutes}-{total_airplane_trip_minutes}={minutes_faster}>>{minutes_faster} minutes faster than driving herself to the interview.
